All right, all right.  Tell you the truth, I have met a sword or two that =
felt a little bloodthirsty; they make me nervous.  But the only real reason=
 I'm answering this note is that I think it gives a good portrait of how si=
lly the idea can get.  Please note that I never claimed that swords speak i=
n human language - or indeed, that they literally speak at all.  But - for =
instance - just as a cat can communicate without speech, or a glance betwee=
n humans can communicate volumes, just so (I still maintain) a sword can le=
t you know a thing or two.  I'm not suggesting that it comes through in cle=
ar sentences, or even Gollumical (Gollumatic?) ones.
I must admit that I di=
dn't expect this tone of response from this group.  Are there any aspects o=
f traditional bushi values that _are_ regarded as deserving of respect arou=
nd here?
Gereg

   Date: Mon, 13 Dec 2004 20:17:53 -0600
   From: Anthony B=
ryant <ajbryant@...>
Subject: Re: swords (was ...Eras)
